## Fiction

- [*Octavia's Brood: Science Fiction Stories from Social Justice Movements*](https://www.akpress.org/octavia-s-brood.html) (2015) edited by adrienne maree brown and Walidah Imarisha
- [*Ceremony*](https://www.thriftbooks.com/w/ceremony-by-leslie-marmon-silko/246068/?resultid=2139b961-64fd-4936-b826-e90541a9094c#isbn=0143104918) (1986) by Leslie Silko
- [*The Patternist* Series](https://www.octaviabutler.com/patternist-series) (1976-1984) by Octavia Butler
- [*A People's Future of the United States: Speculative Fiction from 25 Extraordinary Writers*](https://www.akpress.org/a-people-s-future-of-the-united-states.html) (2019) edited by Victor LaValle and John Joseph Adams
- [*The Moon is a Harsh Mistress*](https://www.thriftbooks.com/w/the-moon-is-a-harsh-mistress-by-robert-a-heinlein/255464/?resultid=057aff7c-2261-4b07-b9cb-26ee0489fbe6#edition=20399737&idiq=28665707) (1966) by Robert A. Heinlein
- [*Parable of the Sower*](https://www.octaviabutler.com/parableseries) (1993) and [*Parable of the Talents*](https://www.octaviabutler.com/parableseries) (1998) by Octavia Butler
- [*Never Whistle at Night: An Indigenous Dark Fiction Anthology*](https://birchbarkbooks.com/products/never-whistle-at-night) (2023) edited by Shane Hawk, Theodore C. Van Alst Jr.
- [*Kindred*](https://www.octaviabutler.com/kindred) (1979) by Octavia Butler
- [*Annie Bot*](https://www.harpercollins.com/products/annie-bot-sierra-greer?variant=41059550855202) (2024) by Sierra Greer
- [*Broken Earth* series](https://rep.club/products/broken-earth-trilogy-box-set?srsltid=AfmBOorDHwm4OkhS7k2O20qJGRV27M72p-cgT1BudSG2UB_TgtA-PtZM) (2015-2017) by N. K. Jemisin
- [*Teixcalaan* series](https://us.macmillan.com/series/teixcalaan) (2019-2021) by Arkady Martine

## Non-fiction

### Movement Building and Analysis

- [*An Abolitionist's Handbook: 12 Steps to Changing Yourself and the World*](https://www.akpress.org/an-abolitionist-s-handbook.html) (2021) by Patrisse Cullors 
- [*Emergent Strategy: Shaping Change, Changing Worlds*](https://www.akpress.org/emergentstrategy.html) (2017) by adrienne maree brown
- [*What It Takes to Heal: How Transforming Ourselves Can Change the World*](https://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/books/726173/what-it-takes-to-heal-by-prentis-hemphill/) (2024) by Prentis Hemphill
- [*If We Burn: The Mass Protest Decade and the Missing Revolution*](https://vincentbevins.com/book2/) (2023) by Vincent Bevins
- [*How We Get Free: Black Feminism and the Combahee River Collective*](https://www.haymarketbooks.org/books/1108-how-we-get-free) (2012) edited by Keeanga-Yamahtta Taylor
- [*How Nonviolence Protects the State*](https://theanarchistlibrary.org/library/peter-gelderloos-how-nonviolence-protects-the-state) (2007) by Peter Gelderloos
- [*Women, Race & Class*](https://www.thriftbooks.com/w/women-race--class_angela-y-davis/252357/#edition=2384754&idiq=10330589) (1981) by Angela Davis
- [*Healing Resistance: A Radically Different Response to Harm*](https://www.parallax.org/product/healing-resistance/) (2020) by Kazu Haga
- [*Loving Corrections*](https://www.akpress.org/loving-corrections.html) (2024) by adrienne maree brown
- [*How We Show Up: Reclaiming Family, Friendship, and Community*](https://miabirdsong.com/how-we-show-up) (2020) by Mia Birdsong
- [*Pleasure Activism: The Politics of Feeling Good*](https://www.akpress.org/pleasure-activism.html) (2019) written and gathered by adrienne maree brown
- [*American Whitelash: A Changing Nation and the Cost of Progress*](https://www.akpress.org/american-whitelash.html) (2023) by Wesley Lowery

- [*An Indigenous Peoples History of the United States*](https://www.beacon.org/An-Indigenous-Peoples-History-of-the-United-States-P1164.aspx) (2015) by Roxanne Dunbar-Ortiz

### Mental Health, Relationships, and Survival

- [*Mad in America: Bad Science, Bad Medicine, and the Enduring Mistreatment of the Mentally Ill*](https://www.hachettebookgroup.com/titles/robert-whitaker/mad-in-america/9781541618060/?lens=basic-books) (2019) by Robert Whitaker

```{r load}

gs4_deauth()

booklist_ <- read_sheet("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1moyOGAkx7BfEeaZPbrDrXKWK2oYudeBaA4T9IwTHAn0/edit#gid=0") %>% 
  drop_na(title)

b <- booklist_ %>% 
  group_by(fiction, gender, race) %>% 
  summarise(n_gender = n())

b_ <- booklist_ %>% 
  group_by(race) %>% 
  summarise(n_race = n())

booklist <- b_ %>% 
  left_join(booklist_, by = "race", 
            relationship = "many-to-many") %>% 
  mutate(fiction = ifelse(fiction == TRUE, 1, 0),
         shorts = ifelse(genre == "short stories", 1, 0),
         read = ifelse(!is.na(finished), 1, 0)) %>% 
  mutate(fiction = ifelse(fiction == TRUE, 
                          "Fiction", 
                          "Non-Fiction")) %>% 
  mutate(fiction = factor(fiction, 
                          levels = c("Non-Fiction", 
                                     "Fiction")),
         gender = factor(gender, 
                         levels = c("Man", 
                                    "Woman",
                                    "Nonbinary", 
                                    "Multiple Authors"),
                         labels = c("Man", 
                                    "Woman",
                                    "Nonbinary", 
                                    str_wrap("Multiple Authors", 9))),
         race = str_wrap(race, 9)) %>% 
  mutate(decade = case_when(year >= 2020 ~ "2020s",
                            year >= 2010 & year < 2020 ~ "2010s",
                            year >= 2000 & year < 2010 ~ "2000s",
                            year >= 1990 & year < 2000 ~ "1990s",
                            year >= 1980 & year < 1990 ~ "1980s",
                            year >= 1970 & year < 1980 ~ "1970s",
                            year >= 1960 & year < 1970 ~ "1960s",
                            year >= 1950 & year < 1960 ~ "1950s",
                            year < 1950 ~ "1949 and Eariler")) %>% 
  mutate(decade = str_wrap(decade, 9)) %>% 
  mutate(month = month(finished,
                       label = TRUE, 
                       abbr = FALSE,))



```

```{r authors, eval=FALSE}
#| fig-height: 4.944376
#| fig-width: 8

authors <- booklist %>% 
  mutate(author = case_when(
    str_detect(author, "adrienne maree brown") ~ "adrienne maree brown",
    str_detect(author, "Roxanne Dunbar-Ortiz") ~ "Roxanne Dunbar-Ortiz",
    str_detect(author, "Cullors") ~ "Patrisse Cullors",
    str_detect(author, "Keeanga-Yamahtta Taylor") ~ "Keeanga-Yamahtta Taylor",
    str_detect(author, "Audre Lorde") ~ "Audre Lorde",
    str_detect(author, "Maya Schenwar and Victoria Law") ~ "Victoria Law",
    TRUE ~ author
    )) %>% 
  mutate(gender = ifelse(author == "adrienne maree brown", 2, gender),
         race = case_when(author == "adrienne maree brown" ~ "Black",
                          author == "Victoria Law" ~ "Asian",
                          TRUE ~ race)) %>%
  filter(gender != 4) %>% 
  group_by(author, gender, race) %>% 
  summarise(n = n())

a <- authors %>% 
  group_by(gender, race) %>% 
  summarise(n = n()) %>% 
  mutate(gender = case_when(gender == 1 ~ "Man",
                            gender == 2 ~ "Woman",
                            gender == 3 ~ "Nonbinary"))

a %>% 
  mutate(gender = factor(gender, 
                         levels = c("Man", 
                                    "Woman",
                                    "Nonbinary")),
         race = str_wrap(race, 9)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(n, reorder(race, n), fill = gender)) +
  geom_col() +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(2,30,2)) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = colors) +
  labs(x = "Number of Authors",
       y = "Author's Race",
       fill = "Author's Gender",
       title = "2024 Author Stats :)") +
  th_book +
  theme(panel.grid.major.y = element_blank(),
        panel.grid.minor.y = element_blank(),
        panel.grid.major.x = element_line(color = "#FFD1F9", 
                                        linewidth = .35, 
                                        linetype = "longdash"),
        panel.grid.minor.x = element_line(color = lighten("#FFD1F9", .5), 
                                        linewidth = .3, 
                                        linetype = "dashed"),)

ggsave("authors.png", width = 8, height = 8 / 1.618,
```

```{r labeled, eval=FALSE}

set.seed(05062023)

b_ <- booklist %>% 
  group_by(race) %>% 
  summarise(n = n())

bb <- booklist %>% 
  drop_na(time) %>% 
  mutate(len = as.numeric(time) - as.numeric(min(time))) %>% 
  mutate(l_text = ifelse(is.na(series), 
                         ifelse(short_title == "...", 
                                str_wrap(title, 50),
                                short_title), 
                         paste0(title, " (", series, ")")))

bb_labels <- bb %>% 
  # filter(finished > as.Date("2024-06-01")) %>%
  filter(label == TRUE) %>% 
  mutate(l_text = ifelse(is.na(series), 
                         ifelse(short_title == "...", 
                                str_wrap(title, 50),
                                short_title), 
                         paste0(series, " series"))) 

bb %>% 
  mutate(len = ifelse(fiction == "Fiction", len / 1.35, len)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(as.Date(finished), len,
             shape = fiction)) +
  # geom_point(aes(fill = gender), size = 5, color = "white") +
  geom_label_repel(aes(label = l_text,
                       color = gender),
                   family = "Changa",
                   size = 3,
                   force = 100,
                   force_pull = 0,
                   max.overlaps = 100,
                   point.padding = unit(10, "inches"),
                   label.padding = 0.15,

  facet_grid(rows = vars(fiction),

             scales = "free_y",
             space = "free_y",
             # strip.position = "left"
             ) +
  scale_x_date(date_breaks = "1 month",
               date_labels = "%B",
               position = "top") +
  scale_fill_manual(values = colors, guide = "none") +
  scale_color_manual(values = colors) +
```
